Message:
I laid my flowers atop
Miss Aura’s casket.
Through the glass case,
I could see her
lying on her side.

Years had passed since
her death, but it didn’t
look that way at all.

It was as though
she were merely asleep.
Even her once flowing locks
were now cropped short...

“You’re the first to ever
come here offering flowers.”

The sword-bearing witch,
Miss Rustica, grew silent
after spilling those words.

I was sure that if
I asked what she meant,
it would only
make her sad again.

That very instant,
a group of men
suddenly appeared,
one holding a knife
up to my neck.

“Hand over that witch
with the golden hair,
or this girl dies!” they said.

I don’t know their motive,
but if we do what they say,
Miss Rustica will be
even more sad...!

I bit the man’s arm
with all of my might.
My body was freed—

But, a sharp pain
ran through my back,
and my chest became red...

Miss Rustica...
Don’t...look at me like that...
